code: @Manual{,   title = {intersimR: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions},   author = {David March},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://spatialmarine.github.io/intersimR/}, }

what: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions
title: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions
text: intersimR provides tools detect quantify local interaction events marine animals vessels using tracking data. package implements simulation-based framework described simulation-based framework detect marine animal-vessel interactions using tracking data, allowing users evaluate attraction following behaviour null-model simulations event-level metrics. package designed support reproducible analysis pipelines, making easy apply framework new datasets across marine species vessel types.

title: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions
text: can install development version package GitHub: installed, load package :

title: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions
text: intersimR includes tools : Extracting local interaction events animal vessel tracks Generating simulation-based null models Computing attraction following behaviour Estimating p-values based repeated simulations Summarising visualising interaction events workflow mirrors structure original methodological paper, generic functions can applied time-synchronised animal–vessel tracking dataset.

title: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions
text: full reference documentation vignettes available : https://spatialmarine.github.io/intersimR/

title: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions
text: Issues, questions, pull requests welcome. Please open issue report bugs suggest improvements.

title: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions

title: Simulation-Based Framework to Detect Animal–Vessel Interactions
text: use intersimR research, please cite methodological paper associated framework published. CITATION file added formal reference available.

title: Add a per-track sequential fix index and a globally-unique fix identifier — add_fix_id
Add a per-track sequential fix index and a globally-unique fix identifier — add_fix_id
text: x track_tbl columns id, lon, lat, time. overwrite Logical; FALSE (default) fixID already exists, error thrown avoid accidental reassignment. Set TRUE recompute.

title: Add a per-track sequential fix index and a globally-unique fix identifier — add_fix_id
text: track_tbl : fixN: integer 1,2,3,... within id ordered time (ties lon/lat) fixID: character unique identifier paste(id, fixN, sep = "_")

what: Coerce inputs to a canonical movement track table — as_track
title: Coerce inputs to a canonical movement track table — as_track
text: as_track() converts data.frame/tibble validated track_tbl columns id, time (POSIXct, UTC), lon, lat (decimal degrees), sorted (id, time). canonical structure intersimR functions expect internally.

title: Coerce inputs to a canonical movement track table — as_track
code: as_track(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' as_track(x, lon, lat, time, id, tz = "UTC", crs = "OGC:CRS84", ...)

title: Coerce inputs to a canonical movement track table — as_track
text: x Input object. ... Reserved future method-specific arguments; unused . lon, lat, time, id Columns (tidy-eval) identifying longitude, latitude, timestamp, track identifier x. tz Character timezone timestamps (default "UTC"). Passed .POSIXct() coercion. crs Coordinate reference string stored attribute (default "OGC:CRS84"). Informational; positions assumed lon/lat (EPSG:4326).

title: Coerce inputs to a canonical movement track table — as_track
text: track_tbl.

title: Coerce inputs to a canonical movement track table — as_track
code: df <- data.frame(   id   = c("a","a","a"),   time = as.POSIXct("2025-01-01 00:00:00", tz = "UTC") + c(0, 60, 120),   lon  = c(0.00, 0.01, 0.02),   lat  = c(0.00, 0.01, 0.02) ) trk <- as_track(df, lon = lon, lat = lat, time = time, id = id) is_track_tbl(trk) #> [1] TRUE

what: Create a land/ocean mask raster for track simulations — create_oceanmask
title: Create a land/ocean mask raster for track simulations — create_oceanmask
text: Creates raster mask values: 0 = ocean 1 = land

title: Create a land/ocean mask raster for track simulations — create_oceanmask
code: create_oceanmask(   bbox,   res,   polygon,   polygon_type = c("land", "ocean"),   crs = "EPSG:4326",   touches = TRUE )

title: Create a land/ocean mask raster for track simulations — create_oceanmask
text: bbox Numeric vector length 4: c(xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) lon/lat. res Numeric. Raster resolution degrees (e.g., 0.01). polygon Spatial polygon defining either land ocean. Either terra::SpatVector sf object. polygon_type Character. One c("land","ocean") indicating polygon represents. crs Character. Target CRS; default EPSG:4326. touches Logical. Passed terra::rasterize(); TRUE, cells touched polygon boundaries included (often preferable near coastlines).

title: Create a land/ocean mask raster for track simulations — create_oceanmask
text: terra::SpatRaster values 0 (ocean) 1 (land).

title: Create a land/ocean mask raster for track simulations — create_oceanmask
text: input polygon can represent either land ocean; set polygon_type accordingly. Areas covered input polygon assigned complementary class (land polygon ocean; ocean polygon land).

what: Detect proximity-based events between animal and vessel — detect_proximity_events
title: Detect proximity-based events between animal and vessel — detect_proximity_events
text: Proximity events contiguous periods within dyad (matchID) paired fixes remain within min_dist_m, allowing internal gaps max_gap_min. Events shorter min_duration_min discarded.

title: Detect proximity-based events between animal and vessel — detect_proximity_events
Detect proximity-based events between animal and vessel — detect_proximity_events
text: pairs data.frame/tibble match_animal_vessels(); requires columns: matchID, fixID, animalID, vesselID, animal_time, dist_m min_dist_m numeric. Maximum distance (meters) consider proximity. min_duration_min numeric. Minimum event duration (minutes). max_gap_min numeric. Maximum allowed gap (minutes) within event.

title: Detect proximity-based events between animal and vessel — detect_proximity_events
text: input pairs augmented eventID (NA selected event)

Extract animal and vessel segments (track_tbl) for a selected proximity event — extract_event_segments
text: x list detect_proximity_events(); contains $data $events eventID character(1). Event identifier extract lead_secs integer(1). Seconds extend window event start (>=0) lag_secs integer(1). Seconds extend window event end (>=0)

title: Extract animal and vessel segments (track_tbl) for a selected proximity event — extract_event_segments
text: list : animal: track_tbl vessel: track_tbl meta: list event metadata window bounds

what: Simulate surrogate tracks for an animal segment — simulate_tracks
title: Simulate surrogate tracks for an animal segment — simulate_tracks
text: Fits surrogate AR movement model (availability) single animal segment generates sim_n simulated tracks timestamps. Optionally constrains simulated points sea using ocean mask (terra).

title: Simulate surrogate tracks for an animal segment — simulate_tracks
code: simulate_tracks(   animal,   sim_n = 1000L,   oceanmask = NULL,   min_locs = 6L,   anchor = c("start", "start_end"),   cores = 1L,   seed = NULL )

title: Simulate surrogate tracks for an animal segment — simulate_tracks
text: animal track_tbl single segment. Requires columns: id, lon, lat, time. sim_n Integer. Number simulations. oceanmask Optional terra::SpatRaster values 0=ocean, 1=land. min_locs Integer. animal < min_locs rows, resampled min_locs. anchor One c("start","start_end"). Fix first point , first+last. cores Integer. Number cores. macOS/Linux uses fork parallelism. seed Optional integer seed reproducibility.

title: Simulate surrogate tracks for an animal segment — simulate_tracks
text: tibble columns: animalID, simID, time, lon, lat

what: Test animal-vessel interactions (attraction / follow) using simulations — test_interactions
title: Test animal-vessel interactions (attraction / follow) using simulations — test_interactions
text: Given animal vessel segment (track_tbl) extracted around observed event, simulate animal tracks, pair vessel, detect proximity events, compute Monte Carlo p-value : "attract": probability null simulation produces >= 1 proximity event "follow" : probability earliest null event duration >= observed duration

title: Test animal-vessel interactions (attraction / follow) using simulations — test_interactions
code: test_interactions(   animal,   vessel,   method = c("attract", "follow"),   min_dist_m,   min_duration_min,   max_gap_min,   sim_n = 1000,   obs_duration_min = NULL,   seed = NULL,   oceanmask = NULL,   min_locs = 6,   anchor = "start_end",   cores = 1,   return_simdata = FALSE )

title: Test animal-vessel interactions (attraction / follow) using simulations — test_interactions
text: animal track_tbl. Animal segment. vessel track_tbl. Vessel segment. method character. "attract" "follow". min_dist_m numeric. Proximity threshold meters. min_duration_min numeric. Minimum event duration minutes. max_gap_min numeric. Maximum allowed internal gap within event (minutes). sim_n integer. Target number simulations. obs_duration_min numeric. Observed duration (minutes) follow test. REQUIRED method == "follow". come extract_event_segments()$meta$duration_min. seed integer NULL. Random seed. oceanmask optional. Passed simulate_tracks(). min_locs integer. Minimum number locations; nrow(animal) <= min_locs, interpolate min_locs + 1. anchor character. Passed simulate_tracks() (e.g., "start" "start_end"). cores integer. Passed simulate_tracks() relevant. return_simdata logical. TRUE, return paired sim data sim events.

title: Test animal-vessel interactions (attraction / follow) using simulations — test_interactions
text: list : result: tibble (one row) p_value summaries meta: list n_valid, n_failed, interpolated, etc. (optional) sim_pairs, sim_events: inspection return_simdata = TRUE
